If you enjoyed reading about journeys and diverse individuals, I would recommend "The Odyssey" by Homer.

This epic poem follows the journey of Odysseus, a brave Greek warrior who gets stranded on an island after a long war between Greece and Troy. 

Throughout his journey back home, Odysseus encounters various challenges, including natural disasters, hostile tribes, and even ghosts from the dead! 

Despite all these obstacles,Odysseus always manages to find a way out of each situation he encounters! 

In the end, after years of wandering on the island, Odysseus finally returns home to his wife Penelope and their son Telemachos! 

Overall, "The Odyssey" is a truly epic story that spans centuries and countless generations!

Based on the preferences you mentioned, I would recommend "The Bad Seed" from 1954.
This movie is about a girl named Rhoda Penmark who seems like an average eight-year-old girl. However, after her rival at school dies in mysterious circumstances at the school picnic, her mother starts to suspect that Rhoda was responsible.
Despite its simple plot, "The Bad Seed" is considered one of the greatest children's films ever made and has won numerous awards including three Academy Awards for Best Picture.

I hope you find this recommendation interesting and helpful.
